p: Emergency workers often place substantial psychological pressure on themselves to work in exceptional circumstances: ‘this job comes with a responsibility to turn up,’ ‘it's what we are trained for’ (p. 24, paramedics quoted in ( 47)) and put their own well-being at risk in the process. Society also places high expectations on the willingness and ability of these workers to put their own needs and concerns aside, and work at maximum capacity for extended periods until services are restored and the ‘emergency’ has subsided.
